members.member: used by function CheckDdlHeader and ReadNameFromDdl to return headerInformation
true if the script contains a CREATE keyword, false eitherwise
index in text where the CREATE keyword starts
true if the script contains a OR ALTER keyword, false otherwise
index in text where the OR ALTER keyword starts
index in text where the OR ALTER keyword ends
index in text where the name starts, this is the full name including schema
first index that is not part of the name anymore, this also includes the proc number
the type of object for text ex.:PROC, TRIGGER, VIEW etc.
schema as extracted from the header
name as extracted from the header
Database name as extracted from the header Will only be meaningful when we have a three part name, currently only the name of the table on which a trigger is created
if the text is a procedure with the number specified, it will contain semicolon + number. ex.:";1" ";2" or ";3" etc.
start index of a name of an object used inside the text currently used for the table triger
one beyond end index of a name of an object used inside the text currently used for the table triger
schema as extracted from inside the header currently used for the schema of a table inside the triger text
name as extracted from inside the header currently used for the name of a table inside the triger text
database name as extracted from inside the header currently used for the name of a table inside the triger text

member.summary: Backups occur only on the primary replica, wherever it is.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.SecondaryOnly
member.summary: Backups occur only on the secondary replicas. If no secondary replicas are online, backup will not be performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.Secondary
member.summary: Backups occur on the secondary replicas, except when the primary replica is the only replica online.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupAutomatedBackupPreference.None
member.summary: No preference is stated for backup on replicas based on its current role. Only BackupPriority and online/connected states will be considered for replica choice.

member.summary: The automated backup preference is unknown. The replica may not be able to communicate with the cluster or quorum may not be set across the Windows Server Failover Cluster.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel
member.summary: The different conditions that can trigger an automatic failover in an Availability Group. These setting are cumulative, meaning that as the setting increases in value it encompases all the previous conditions and adds extra ones.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnServerDown
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when the SQL Server service is down.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnServerUnresponsive
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when SQL Server is down or unresponsive, or when the Avaialbility Group's primary replica is in a failed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnCriticalServerErrors
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when any condition level of lower value is satisfied or when a critical server error occurs. If no setting for an Availability Group is specified, this is the default value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnModerateServerErrors
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when any condition level of lower value is satisfied or when a moderate server error occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.OnAnyQualifiedFailureCondition
member.summary: Automatic failover is triggered when any condition level of lower value is satisfied or when a qualifying failure condition occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AvailabilityGroupFailureConditionLevel.Unknown
member.summary: The failure condition level is unknown. The replica may not be able to communicate with the cluster or quorum may not be set across the Windows Server Failover Cluster.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.PermissionDecode.permissionTypeToEnumMapping
member.summary: Used to cache the Permission Type -> enum values mappings. We're only caching this mapping because this one requires iterating through all of the values of the specified enum type and so can get expensive with all the reflection lookups. The other methods in this class work on a single instance of an enum value so the cost is much smaller and not worth the overhead of the caching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Internal.SqlSecureString.Split(System.Char[])
member.summary: Returns a SqlSecureString array containing the substrings of this instance that are delimited by a specific character array
member.param: The array of delimiter characters, an empty array, or null
member.returns:
An array consisting for a single element that contains a copy of this instance, if this instance contains none of the characters in separator. -or- An array of substrings, if this instance is delimited by one or more characters in separator. -or- An array of the substrings of this instance that are delimited by white space characters, if those characters occur in this instance and separator is null or contains no delimiter characters.
An empty SqlSecureString is returned for any substring in which two delimiters are adjacent, or if a delimiter is found at the beginning or end of this instance. Delimiter characters are not included in the substrings.

An empty SqlSecureString is returned for any substring in which two delimiters are adjacent, or if a delimiter is found at the beginning or end of this instance. Delimiter characters are not included in the substrings.
